titleStmt.title: A dialogue full of pithe and pleasure: betvveene three phylosophers: Antonio, Meandro, and Dinarco vpon the dignitie, or indignitie of man. Partly translated out of Italian, and partly set downe by way of obseruation. By Nicholas Breton, Gentleman.
titleStmt.author: Breton, Nicholas, 1545?-1626?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T[homas] C[reede] for Iohn Browne, and are to be solde at his shop in Saint Dunstons Church-yard in Fleetstreete,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: Of the dignitie or indignitie of man.
At least quire C outer forme and most of quire D are in 2 settings; C3r line 1 ends (1) "Beast" or (2) "vp".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop in Saint Dunstons Church-yard in Fleetstreete
